page.title: 04TRANSPORT:RURAL NEEDS
page.content: In an area with small isolated communities it is vital to have some form of transport. With no shop,no public house and one Post Office it is almost impossible to cope with modern life unless some form of transport is used. Many fathers are employed outside the area and they drive or ride to work. Farmers frequently visit the local markets and use{tractors}as their means of tranport.{Pick-up vans}and{estate cars and{Land Rovers}are well-suited to winter driving in narrow lanes. Any vehicle going by usually merits a gaze and the passage of the day can be measured by the timing of the{milk {lorry or the school bus.}A visitor's car is soon spotted but familiar faces and vehicles are greeted with a friendly wave.Neighbours help each other out if transport problems arise.
